SourceText: ğŸ’› Often, we donâ€™t treat ourselves as well as we treat our friends and family.

SourceText: ğŸŒ·When we are kind to ourselves, we can be kind to others It also help us deal with hard things.

SourceText: Sometimes we experience a lot of emotions and feelings, especially when caring for others. How should we manage them?

SourceText: ğŸ’™ It is important to notice and accept your negative emotions. Then, you will be able to tell yourself itâ€™s OK and be kind to yourself.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} is a single mother of young children. She often feels that between work, parenting, and managing the home, she does not have enough time for her children. She wants to spend more time with {F3_SON_7}, her middle child.
text: {F3_MOTHER} merupakan seorang ibu tunggal dan mempunyai anak-anak yang masih kecil. Dia merasakan bahawa dia tidak mempunyai masa untuk anak-anaknya, kerana masanya banyak dihabiskan untuk bekerja, tugas keibubapaan dan menguruskan rumah tangga. Dia ingin meluangkan lebih banyak masa bersama anak keduanya iaitu {F3_SON_7}.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: What is it, {F3_SON_7}? Are you okay?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Apa yang berlaku, {F3_SON_7}? Kamu baik-baik sahaja?

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: All my friends in class had a parent attend our school performance today and you were not there! I hate that you have to work all the time. It is not fair!
text: {F3_SON_7}: Semua ibu bapa rakan saya menghadiri persembahan di sekolah hari ini tetapi Mummy tidak hadir! Saya rasakan ini tidak adil kerana Mummy asyik bekerja setiap masa!

SourceText: (Thinking...)
text: (Berfikir...)

SourceText: - Iâ€™m trying my best.
text: - Saya sedang cuba sedaya upaya.

SourceText: - Trying to make ends meet and raise three children alone is very difficult.
text: - Hidup kais pagi makan pagi, kais petang makan petang untuk membesarkan tiga anak seorang diri sangat sukar.

SourceText: - Other parents find this hard too. Iâ€™m not alone.
text: - Bukan saya seorang yang begini, ibu bapa yang lain merasakan kesukaran yang sama.

SourceText: - This is not the last school performance. There will be other opportunities to show up for {F3_SON_7}.
text: - Ini bukan persembahan sekolah yang terakhir buat {F3_SON_7}. Mesti ada peluang lain untuk saya hadir sama.

SourceText: - Things have been very difficult lately, and I need to take some time out to look after myself.
text: - Sejak kebelakangan ini, saya perlukan sedikit masa untuk menjaga diri sendiri kerana keadaan begitu sulit bagi saya.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: My {F3_SON_7}, you practised so hard for this performance. I am sorry I could not get out of work. Can you give me my own performance after dinner? I want to see how brilliant you are!
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu telah berlatih dengan bersungguh-sungguh untuk persembahan ini, {F3_SON_7}. Maafkan Mummy kerana Mummy perlu bekerja. Boleh tak kamu buat persembahan istimewa, khas untuk Mummy lepas makan malam nanti? Mummy juga ingin melihat betapa hebatnya anak Mummy ini!

SourceText: {F3_SON_7}: I will try, Mama, but I still wish you were there.
text: {F3_SON_7}: Saya cuba, Mummyâ€¦ tapi saya masih berharap Mummy ada tadi.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants his young children to learn about respect for their elders. His parents taught him to respect his elders and he wants his children to do the same. Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} and his wife, {F1_MOTHER} discuss their parenting values.
text: {F1_FATHER} mahu anak-anaknya yang masih kecil untuk belajar menghormati orang yang lebih tua. Ibu bapanya mengajarkan hal yang sama dan mahu anaknya mengikuti jejaknya. Mari kita lihat bagaimana {F1_FATHER} dan isterinya, {F1_MOTHER} berbincang tentang nilai keibubapaan mereka.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: When I was playing with our kids earlier, they raised their voices at me and I was shocked.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Saya terkejut kerana anak-anak kita meninggikan suara pada saya ketika saya bermain dengan mereka sebentar tadi.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Hmm, maybe they were trying to tell you something with excitement.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Hmm, mungkin mereka teruja dan pada masa yang sama, mereka ingin memberitahu kamu sesuatu.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Hmm, maybe. When I was young, my parents never allowed me to speak loudly to them. It is a sign of respect for elders.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Hmm, mungkin juga. Masa kecil dulu, Abah Ibu tak pernah benarkan saya meninggikan suara kepada mereka, sebagai tanda penghormatan kepada orang yang lebih tua.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: I think that respect for elders is very important and a good tradition to pass down to our kids. We also want our kids to be open with their feelings.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Menyemai sikap hormat terhadap orang tua memang penting dan tradisi ini perlu diturunkan kepada anak kita. Walaubagaimanapun, kita juga mahu anak-anak kita bersikap terbuka tentang perasaan mereka.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s true. We can help our kids to express themselves while still being respectful.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Betul. Kita boleh bantu anak-anak kita luahkan perasaan tapi dalam masa yang sama tetap menghormati orang lain.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Exactly!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Tepat sekali!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} is a dad committed to positive parenting. Letâ€™s see how he approaches time with his son, {F1_SON_5}:
text: {F1_FATHER} ialah ayah yang bersungguh-sungguh ingin menerapkan keibubapaan positif. Mari kita lihat bagaimana dia memanfaatkan masa bersama anaknya, {F1_SON_5}:

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Yes! I want to build more. Come help me build a house for our family!

SourceText: ğŸ“–This skill is about helping your child learn to read.

SourceText: â­ Our first lesson today is about enjoying books with your child.
text: â­ Pelajaran pertama kita pada hari ini ialah tentang menghayati buku dengan anak anda.

SourceText: Did you know? Reading can happen anywhere, like at home or even when you are out!
text: Tahukah anda? Aktiviti membaca boleh berlaku di mana-mana saja, di rumah ataupun semasa anda keluar bersama!

SourceText: Now, hereâ€™s a question for you.
text: Sekarang, ini soalan untuk anda.

SourceText: Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} reads with his son, {F1_SON_5}. Notice how he uses the pictures in the book to teach.
text: Mari kita lihat bagaimana {F1_FATHER} membaca dengan anak lelakinya, {F1_SON_5}. Perhatikan bagaimana dia mengajar dengan menggunakan gambar-gambar yang ada dalam buku.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, this book looks interesting! Can you see the picture? The tiger is smiling. Why do you think he is smiling?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah, buku ini nampak menarik! Nampak tak gambar harimau yang sedang tersenyum? Agaknya, kenapa harimau senyum?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Wow, what is happening here? What is the tiger holding?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah, harimau ini sedang pegang apa? Apa yang berlaku?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: A balloon!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Belon!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s right, it's a balloon, what colour is it?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Betul! Apakah warna belon itu?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Red!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Merah!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Yes, itâ€™s a red balloon! Why do you think the tiger is holding the red balloon? Do you think itâ€™s his birthday? Yes! The tiger is holding the red balloon because itâ€™s his birthday!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ya, itu belon merah! Kenapa harimau itu pegang belon warna merah? Adakah kerana hari ini hari jadinya? Ya! Harimau itu pegang belon merah kerana hari ini hari jadinya!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: What is the first sound of â€œballoonâ€? â€œBâ€? Thatâ€™s right, this letter makes the sound â€œBâ€! Can you think of any other words that start with â€œBâ€? Yes! â€œBall also starts with â€œBâ€. If you canâ€™t think of any more I can help! What about â€œbasketâ€?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Apa bunyi pertama bagi â€œbelonâ€? â€œBâ€? Betul, huruf ini berbunyi sebagai â€œBâ€! Ada tak perkataan lain yang bermula dengan â€œBâ€? Ya! â€œBola juga bermula dengan â€œBâ€. Ayah boleh bantu jika kamu tidak dapat fikir perkataan lain! Bagaimana dengan â€œbakulâ€?

SourceText: Letâ€™s see how {F1_MOTHER} is practising numbers with her son, {F1_SON_5} in the kitchen:
text: {F1_MOTHER} sedang berlatih menggunakan nombor di dapur bersama anaknya, {F1_SON_5}. Mari kita hayati situasi tersebut:

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for cooking with me! Youâ€™re so helpful! What do you have here?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Anak Ibu sangat baik! Terima kasih kerana membantu Ibu memasak! Apa yang ada di depan anak Ibu?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Potatoes!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Kentang!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thatâ€™s right! Potatoes! How many potatoes do you have?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Betul! Ini kentang! Jadi, berapa biji kentang yang kamu ada?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I haveâ€¦ Five!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Saya ada... Lima!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thatâ€™s right! One, two, three, fourâ€¦ five! Five potatoes!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Betul! Kita kira, satu, dua, tiga, empatâ€¦ dan lima! Ada lima biji kentang!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Can you give me two potatoes?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Boleh berikan 2 biji kentang kepada Ibu?

SourceText: Thatâ€™s right! Oneâ€¦ twoâ€¦!
text: Betul! Satuâ€¦ duaâ€¦!

SourceText: How many potatoes are left?
text: Berapa biji kentang yang tinggal?

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Is it difficult? Donâ€™t worry, letâ€™s count together! Letâ€™s seeâ€¦ we had five, and you gave me two, now there are oneâ€¦ twoâ€¦ three remaining! There are three potatoes left!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Rasa susah ke? Tak apa, jom kita kira bersama-sama! Tadi... kita ada lima biji kentang, anak Ibu berikan 2 biji kentang, jadi sekarang ada satu... dua... tiga biji yang tinggal! Ada lagi tiga biji kentang!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Three potatoes left!

SourceText: Once your child knows about numbers and groups of things, they can start learning more number skills â­

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four ways for you to encourage your child to practise his number skills:
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ Empat cara ini dapat membantu anda memberi galakan supaya anak anda dapat berlatih menggunakan kemahiran nombor yang diperoleh:

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Ask your child to help sort things into groups, such as putting all the leaves together when cooking.
text: ğŸŒ± Minta anak anda untuk membantu asingkan sesuatu ke dalam kumpulan, sebagai contoh kumpulkan semua sayur bersama-sama ketika memasak.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Ask your child to find 5 of something, like sticks, and then to order them from smallest to biggest. â¬†ï¸ Then order them a different way, like from lightest to darkest!
text: ğŸ˜ƒ Minta anak anda cari 5 benda, macam ranting, lepas tu susun dari yang paling kecil ke paling besar â¬†ï¸ Lepas tu cuba susun cara lain pula, contohnya dari warna paling cerah ke paling gelap!

SourceText: âœ¨ Help your child think about groups! Say: â€œA potato is a round red vegetable. Can you think of something else that is red like a potato?â€ Then: â€œCan you think of something that is also round but bigger than a potato?â€ âš½
text: âœ¨ Bantu anak anda fikirkan tentang kumpulan! Katakan: â€œKentang ialah sayur kuning dan bulat. Bolehkah kamu fikirkan benda lain yang berwarna kuning seperti kentang?â€ kemudian: â€œBolehkah kamu fikirkan sesuatu yang bulat tetapi lebih besar daripada kentang?â€ âš½

SourceText: â¬†ï¸â¬‡ï¸ Once they know about numbers, your child might be able to start learning about adding and taking away!
text: â¬†ï¸â¬‡ï¸ Anak anda boleh belajar membaca dengan teknik menambah dan mengurangkan jika dia sudah mengenal nombor!

SourceText: ğŸš Use activities similar to counting exercises, like cooking, sorting clothes, shopping, or building things!

SourceText: ğŸ… Letâ€™s start by adding. Say: â€œI have two potatoes. When I add two more, how many do I have?â€ Help your child get the answer! Keep practising and, after a while, make it more difficult!
text: ğŸ… Jom mula dengan tambah nombor. Cuba cakap: â€œSaya ada dua biji kentang. Kalau saya tambah dua lagi, jadi berapa semuanya?â€ Bantu anak anda kira jawapannya! Teruskan berlatih, dan lama-lama boleh cuba soalan yang lebih susah!

SourceText: â¬‡ï¸ Repeat the activity, but take things away: â€œI have five potatoes. When I take two away, how many do I have?â€
text: â¬‡ï¸ Ulangkan aktiviti tersebut, tetapi dengan cara mengurangkan nombor pula. "Saya mempunyai lima biji kentang. Berapa banyak yang saya ada jika saya mengurangkan dua biji kentang?â€

SourceText: ğŸ”„ Practise anywhere and everywhere! You can use different things like balls or shoes. You can also do the game in your imaginations.

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ If you think they are ready, ask them to find 5 stones. Show them that you can make 5 stones with one group of 1 stone and another of 4 stones

SourceText: ğŸ”Ÿ When they are ready, do the same activity with bigger numbers - up to 10 stones.

SourceText: ğŸ’š Go slowly and help your child build confidence by doing things they are ready for and know how to do.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ Always encourage their effort and praise them. Mistakes are okay, too!

SourceText: ğŸ‰ Keep learning fun. It helps them stay excited and motivated!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} wants to spend more time helping her daughter, {F3_DAUGTHER_4}, learn through play together. Letâ€™s see how both of them do it:

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4}: I want toâ€¦ Build a house out of bed sheets!
text: {F3_DAUGTHER_4}: Saya nak... Bina rumah menggunakan cadar!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Great idea! What do we need to do first?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Idea yang bagus! Apa yang kita perlu lakukan terlebih dahulu?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4}: First, we hang one bed sheet from the bed on top. Look! Itâ€™s our first wall! Then, we can use a pillow at the bottom.
text: {F3_DAUGTHER_4}: Mummy tengok, mula-mula, kita sangkut satu cadar di sebelah atas katil. Itu jadi dinding kita yang pertama! Selepas itu, kita gunakan bantal untuk bahagian bawah.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Thatâ€™s a great idea, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}! You are thinking through the steps so carefully!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Well done, {F3_DAUGTHER_4}! This is such a nice house.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Wah, sangat hebat!, {F3_DAUGTHER_4}! Cantiknya rumah ni.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4}: Can we read our bedtime story here tonight?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Of course, {F3_DAUGTHER_4}!

SourceText: Todayâ€™s parenting skill is about helping your child know how to learn from their mistakes. ğŸ’š
text: Kemahiran keibubapaan hari ini berkenaan membantu anak anda belajar daripada kesilapan mereka. ğŸ’š

SourceText: Learning from our mistakes can help us avoid them in the future. ğŸŒ·
text: Belajar daripada kesilapan dapat membantu kita mengelakkan diri dari membuat kesilapan yang sama pada masa akan datang. ğŸŒ·

SourceText: It can also help us be more supportive to ourselves and less harsh when things do not go well. ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Ia juga dapat membantu kita menjadi lebih pemaaf terhadap diri sendiri ketika sesuatu perkara tidak berjalan dengan baik. ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: What do you think about this?
text: Apa pendapat anda tentang perkara ini?

SourceText: True or False: If my child understands their mistake and says sorry, that means I can bring up other mistakes they have made so that they learn.
text: Betul atau Salah: Saya boleh ungkit semula kesilapan lain yang anak saya lakukan supaya dia dapat memahami apa salahnya dan meminta maaf.

SourceText: âœ¨ Your child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them. ğŸ’™
text: âœ¨ Anak anda mungkin rasa bersalah kerana telah melakukan kesilapan. Pujinya kerana meminta maaf dan tunjukkan bahawa anda berbangga dengannya. ğŸ’™

SourceText: ğŸ˜” Your child may be tempted to hide mistakes from you out of fear if they feel unsupported.
text: ğŸ˜” Jika mereka berasa tidak disokong, anak anda mungkin hendak menyembunyikan kesilapan daripada anda kerana berasa takut.

SourceText: âœ¨ Your child probably feels very bad about making a mistake. Praise them for apologising and show that you are proud of them for realising and saying sorry. ğŸ’™
text: âœ¨ Anak anda mungkin rasa bersalah kerana telah melakukan kesilapan. Pujinya kerana meminta maaf dan tunjukkan bahawa anda berbangga dengannya kerana sedar akan kesilapan dan meminta maaf. ğŸ’™

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} is getting a bit too active indoors, today. Letâ€™s see how her uncle, {F3_UNCLE}, reacts:
text: Mari kita lihat bagaimana reaksi {F3_UNCLE} selepas melihat anak saudaranya {F3_DAUGHTER_4} menjadi sangat aktif dalam rumah pada hari ini:

SourceText: {F3_UNCLE}: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}, watch where youâ€™re going! Youâ€™re going to break something.
text: {F3_UNCLE}: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}, hati-hati bermain! Nanti kamu pecahkan barang pula.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: No I wonâ€™t! Look! Iâ€™m so fast!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Tak nak! Tengok ni! Saya laju sangat!

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} runs into a table and breaks a vase. {F3_UNCLE} sees and is concerned.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} berlari ke arah meja dan memecahkan sebuah pasu. {F3_UNCLE} melihatnya dan berasa bimbang.

SourceText: {F3_UNCLE}: Are you hurt??
text: {F3_UNCLE}: Kamu cedera??

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: No, uncle. Iâ€™m so, so sorry for breaking the vaseâ€¦ I didnâ€™t see it.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Tak, Uncle. Saya betul-betul minta maaf sebab pecahkan pasu tuâ€¦ Saya tak nampak tadi.

SourceText: {F3_UNCLE}: Thank you for realising your mistake and apologising. Do you know how you could have prevented that from happening?
text: {F3_UNCLE}: Terima kasih sebab kamu sedar kesilapan kamu dan meminta maaf. Kamu tahu apa yang patut kamu lakukan supaya perkara ini tidak berlaku lagi?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yes, I should have listened. I continued running even after you said so.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Ya, saya sepatutnya dengar cakap Uncle. Tapi, saya terus sahaja berlari selepas Uncle beri amaran.

SourceText: {F3_UNCLE}: Itâ€™s OK, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Iâ€™m proud that you are able to learn from your mistakes. Letâ€™s get a broom to sweep up the pieces. We may be able to repair the vase with some glue.
text: {F3_UNCLE}: Tidak mengapa, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Uncle bangga kerana kamu belajar daripada kesilapan. Jom ambil penyapu dan kemas pasu yang pecah tadi. Mungkin kita boleh baiki pasu itu dengan gam.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okayâ€¦
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okeyâ€¦

SourceText: 4ï¸âƒ£ Here are four tips that you can use to help your child learn from their mistakes:
text: 4ï¸âƒ£ Untuk membantu anak anda belajar daripada kesilapan mereka, ini empat tip yang anda boleh gunakan:

SourceText: 2ï¸âƒ£ PRAISE EFFORT
text: 2ï¸âƒ£ PUJI ATAS USAHA

SourceText: ğŸ’› Praise your child for the effort they put into their learning even if they did not succeed.
text: ğŸ’› Memuji anak anda atas usaha yang mereka lakukan dalam pembelajaran walaupun mereka tidak berjaya.

SourceText: âœ¨ Effort is more important than mastering a specific skill.
text: âœ¨ Usaha sebenarnya lebih penting daripada penguasaan kemahiran tertentu.

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ ALLOW FOR MISTAKES TO HAPPEN
text: 3ï¸âƒ£ BENARKAN KESILAPAN BERLAKU

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Mistakes are part of learning. . Itâ€™s okay for your child to make them. It helps them learn and grow!
text: ğŸŒ± Tak apa sekiranya anak anda membuat kesilapan. Ianya merupakan sebahagian dari proses untuk membantu mereka belajar dan berkembang!

SourceText: â“It can be tempting to jump in and fix things for your child, especially when you know the â€œrightâ€ answer. But we have to let them learn how to do it themselves.
text: â“Memang kadang-kadang rasa terus nak tolong anak selesaikan sesuatu, terutama bila kita tahu jawapan yang â€œbetulâ€. Tapi kita kena beri mereka peluang untuk belajar lakukannya sendiri.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ You can talk to your child about their mistakes and allow them to figure out a way to solve their problems and do better next time.
text: ğŸ˜ƒ Anda boleh berbual dengan anak anda tentang kesilapan mereka, dan beri peluang untuk dia fikir sendiri cara selesaikan masalah dan cuba buat lebih baik lain kali.

SourceText: ğŸ“– Try and share your own failures with your child and discuss how they helped you develop and grow.
text: ğŸ“– Cuba berkongsi kegagalan anda sendiri dengan anak anda dan bincangkan bagaimana kegagalan anda telah dapat membantu anda bangkit dan menjadi lebih dewasa.

SourceText: âœ… This helps your child learn that you do not have to be perfect all the time.
text: âœ… Ini akan bantu anak anda faham yang tak perlu jadi sempurna sepanjang masa.

SourceText: Your home activity today is to share a story with your child about a time you learned from a mistake. It can be something from when you were a child yourself or another life lesson. â­

SourceText: Let's do a quick quiz!

SourceText: True or False: All children develop at the same speed as each other.
text: Betul atau Salah: Semua kanak-kanak melalui peringkat perkembangan yang sama dengan rakan-rakan yang seumur dengan mereka.

SourceText: âŒ That is incorrect.
text: âŒ Jawapan anda salah.

SourceText: âœ¨ Each child is unique and will develop at their own pace. Some children may develop in some ways faster than others, while some may take more time.
text: âœ¨ Setiap kanak-kanak adalah unik dan akan membesar mengikut perkembangannya sendiri. Sesetengah kanak-kanak mungkin akan membesar dengan lebih cepat berbanding rakan mereka, namun ada juga yang memerlukan lebih banyak masa untuk membesar.

SourceText: ğŸ’š It is important that parents are patient and supportive, recognising that every child has their own individual path of development.
text: ğŸ’š Penting untuk anda bersabar dan sentiasa menyokong anak, sambil ingat bahawa setiap anak ada perjalanan perkembangan yang tersendiri.

SourceText: â—Remember that issues with your childâ€™s development are not always obvious, and your childâ€™s condition is NOT your fault.
text: â—Sentiasa ingat bahawa isu berkaitan perkembangan anak tidak selalunya jelas, dan bukanlah salah anda jika anda tidak menyedari keadaan anak anda pada peringkat awal.

SourceText: ğŸš© If you have concerns about your child's development, you should consult with a professional to get support and advice.
text: ğŸš© Dapatkan pandangan daripada pakar jika anda risau mengenai perkembangan anak anda.

SourceText: âœ…Correct!
text: âœ…Betul!

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_2} and her father, {F1_FATHER} are spending time together. Letâ€™s see how {F1_FATHER} encourages his daughter to keep on trying:
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_2} dan ayahnya, {F1_FATHER} meluangkan masa bersama-sama. Mari kita lihat bagaimana {F1_FATHER} menggalakkan anaknya untuk terus mencuba:

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}, I have 5 minutes to spend some time with you. What would you like to do?
text: {F1_FATHER}: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}, Ayah boleh meluangkan masa selama 5 minit dengan kamu. Apa yang kamu ingin lakukan?

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Letâ€™s play with the ball outside, Ayah!
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Jom kita main bola di luar, Ayah!

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Iâ€™m not good at thisâ€¦
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}: Saya tidak pandai main bolaâ€¦

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I can see that you are upset, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. Itâ€™s not easy but letâ€™s practise a little bit more. I know you can do it! Come, letâ€™s try again.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ayah nampak kamu tengah sedih, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}. Memang tak mudah, tapi jom kita cuba lagi. Ayah tahu kamu boleh buat! Jom, kita cuba.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Five catches in a row! You seem really proud to have made it to five, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Wah, tangkap bola lima kali berturut-turut! Kamu nampak seronok dan bangga kerana dapat mencapai lima kali, {F1_DAUGHTER_2}!

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_2}: I did it! Letâ€™s try 10!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Gently kick the ball using the inside of your foot, like this.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I want to do it now!!

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: No, I want to do it first!!
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Tak boleh, saya nak cuba dulu!!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: It can be hard to wait but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, how about you suggest a way for us to take turns kicking the ball?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Memang susah nak sabar dan tunggu giliran, tapi kita tak boleh tendang satu bola ini pada masa yang serentak, kan? {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, apa kata kamu berikan cadangan supaya kita boleh cuba menendang bola ini secara bergilir-gilir?

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Hmmâ€¦ How about we make a circle, and I kick the ball to {F1_SON_5}, then he kicks it to you Ayah, and you kick it back to me!
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Okey! Apa kata kita buat bulatan dan saya tendang bola ini pada {F1_SON_5}, lepas itu dia tendang bola ini pada Ayah dan Ayah tendang bola ini balik kepada saya!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: But I want to go first, not second!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Tapi saya nak tendang dulu, nak jadi yang pertama, bukan yang kedua!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Thatâ€™s a fair point, {F1_SON_5}. What if we stick to the circle idea and wait for our turn? Itâ€™ll be fun and everyone gets a chance.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Idea yang baik juga, {F1_SON_5}. Tapi macam mana kalau kita ikut idea Ayah untuk main dalam bulatan dan tunggu giliran? Mesti lagi seronok, semua orang dapat peluang main.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okayâ€¦ Letâ€™s try.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Okeyâ€¦ Jom cuba.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Good job, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! You led the way, and we all had so much fun taking turns! {F1_SON_5}, you were also great at patiently waiting for your turn.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Syabas, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Kamu yang beri cadangan ini dan kita sangat seronok mendapat giliran masing-masing untuk menendang bola! {F1_SON_5}, kamu sangat hebat kerana sabar menunggu giliran.

SourceText: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Thanks Ayah!
text: {F1_DAUGHTER_6}: Terima kasih Ayah!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: That was fun! Letâ€™s do it again!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Seronoklah tadi! Jom main lagi!

SourceText: 3ï¸âƒ£ Here are three steps to help you manage your stress:

SourceText: ğŸ“ Grab a pen and piece of paper.

SourceText: â¸ Take a moment to check in with yourself - how stressed are you right now?
text: â¸ Ambil masa sekejap untuk tanya diri sendiri - Adakah saya tertekan sekarang? Sangat tertekan atau sedikit sahaja?

SourceText: â­ Write a number from 0 to 100 on how stressed you are.
text: â­ Tulis satu nombor dari 0 hingga 100 untuk tunjuk tahap tekanan yang anda rasa sekarang.

SourceText: â“ How does stress feel for you? Do you feel tense? Do you have low energy? Do you have trouble sleeping or focusing? Write these down.
text: â“Bagaimana anda mengalami tekanan? Adakah badan anda berasa tegang? Adakah anda kekurangan tenaga? Adakah anda mengalami kesukaran tidur atau fokus? Cuba tulis semua yang anda rasa.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Understanding how stress shows up in your body can help you better manage it.
text: ğŸŒ± Bila anda faham macam mana tekanan muncul dalam badan, lebih mudah untuk anda menguruskannya dengan cara yang lebih baik.

SourceText: ğŸš© Whatâ€™s causing your stress? Write them down.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ When you know whatâ€™s stressing you out, you can starting finding ways to address and manage it.

SourceText: ğŸ¨ Now think - what do you enjoy doing?

SourceText: ğŸ’š There are different ways to care for yourself, such as walking, praying, and reading. Activities that help you manage stress are called â€˜self-careâ€™.
text: ğŸ’š Jaga diri anda dengan melakukan perkara seperti berjalan, sembahyang dan membaca. Aktiviti yang membantu anda menguruskan tekanan dipanggil â€˜penjagaan kendiriâ€™.

SourceText: âœ¨ Reflect on your daily life - how can you reduce your stress?

SourceText: â˜• Can you add more self-care into your routine - even something small?

SourceText: Todayâ€™s skill is all about how to help your child follow instructions. ğŸ˜ƒ
text: Kemahiran hari ini adalah mengenai cara untuk membantu anak anda mengikuti arahan. ğŸ˜ƒ

SourceText: Even the best behaved children only follow instructions about 50% of the time. â°
text: Kanak-kanak yang paling baik kelakuannya sekalipun hanya mengikuti arahan kira-kira separuh masa. â°

SourceText: Being more effective about how you give instructions can make things more peaceful and calm at home. ğŸŒ±
text: Bila anda beri arahan dengan cara yang lebih berkesan, suasana di rumah pun boleh jadi lebih tenang dan harmoni. ğŸŒ±

SourceText: True or false: It does not matter whether you give an instruction in a positive or negative way.
text: Betul atau salah: Tidak kira sama ada anda memberi arahan dengan cara positif atau negatif kerana kesannya masih sama.

SourceText: Children are more likely to follow an instruction when it is worded in a positive way.
text: Apabila arahan diberikan dalam cara yang positif, kanak-kanak lebih cenderung untuk mengikut arahan.

SourceText: ğŸ’™ Negative instructions like, â€œDonâ€™t do that!â€ can make children (and us) feel bad ğŸ˜£
text: ğŸ’™ Kanak-kanak (dan kita juga) akan rasa bersalah jika arahan yang negatif diberikan seperti "Jangan lakukannya!" ğŸ˜£

SourceText: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} is playing with the handphone on the floor.
text: {F3_DAUGTHER_4} sedang bermain telefon di lantai.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: It is nice to see you playing quietly with the handphone while I clear up after dinner, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. In 3 minutes, it will be bedtime and you will need to give the handphone back to me.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Seronok melihat kamu bermain dengan tenang bersama telefon sementara Mummy mengemas meja makan, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. 3 minit lagi sudah waktu tidur, nanti beri semula telefon tersebut kepada Mummy ya.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: [after 3 minutes] 3 minutes is up, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Please give me back the phone.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: [selepas 3 minit] Dah cukup 3 minit, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Tolong pulangkan telefon kepada Mummy ya.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: No!! Iâ€™m not done!!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Tak nak!! Saya belum habis lagi!!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: I know itâ€™s hard to stop when youâ€™re having fun. But we agreed on 3 minutes. Come {F3_DAUGHTER_4}, letâ€™s go read a bit.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Mummy tahu susah nak berhenti bila tengah seronok. Tapi kita dah setuju 3 minit sahaja. Jom {F3_DAUGHTER_4}, kita pergi baca buku pula.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Thank you for handing the handphone back to me, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Did you like the story we read?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Terima kasih sebab pulangkan telefon pada Mummy, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Kamu suka tak cerita yang kita baca tadi?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yes, mummy.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Ya, saya suka, Mummy!

SourceText: â­Say the behaviour you want your child to do. For example: â€œPlease take your shoes off when you come inside, Adam.â€
text: â­Sebutkan tingkah laku yang anda mahu anak anda lakukan. Contohnya: "Adam, tolong buka kasut kamu apabila masuk ke dalam rumah."

SourceText: ğŸ‘€Use your childâ€™s name to get their attention, go down to their level, and make eye contact.

SourceText: â­Use positive words when giving instructions. For example, say â€œTalk in a quiet voice,â€ instead of â€œDonâ€™t shout.â€

SourceText: Hereâ€™s a quick question for you:

SourceText: True or false: Family rules should be set by the parents because our children are too young to decide for themselves.
text: Betul atau salah: Peraturan keluarga perlu ditetapkan oleh ibu bapa kerana anak kita terlalu mentah untuk membuat keputusan sendiri.

SourceText: â° They are more likely to follow the rule if they helped to develop the rule.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} is spending too much time watching TV before his homework is finished. Letâ€™s see how his mother, {F1_MOTHER}, helps him create a family rule about this:
text: {F1_SON_5} menghabiskan banyak masa dengan menonton TV sebelum menyiapkan kerja sekolah. Mari kita lihat bagaimana ibunya, {F1_MOTHER}, membantunya dalam mencipta peraturan keluarga tentang masalah ini:

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: It is important to finish your homework so you can do well in school. Letâ€™s make a rule about watching TV.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Kerja sekolah perlu disiapkan dan ini penting untuk kamu berjaya di sekolah. Jom kita buat peraturan tentang menonton TV.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Do I have to? I want to watch TV now.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Perlu ke, Ibu? Saya nak tengok TV sekarang.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: I know itâ€™s hard, but what do you think would be a fair rule?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Ibu tahu susah, tapi apa pendapat kamu kalau kita buat peraturan yang semua orang boleh ikut?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Ummmâ€¦ maybe I can watch TV as much as I want, but only after I do my homework.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Hmmmâ€¦kalau begitu, mungkin saya boleh menonton TV selama yang boleh, tetapi selepas saya siapkan kerja sekolah.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: I like that idea, but letâ€™s limit it to 1 hour per day. How does that sound?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Idea yang menarik, tetapi mari kita hadkan kepada 1 jam sehari. Boleh?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Only one hour? Thatâ€™s not much. Fineâ€¦
text: {F1_SON_5}: Satu jam je? Sikitnya... okeylahâ€¦

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Thank you for doing your homework before watching TV, {F1_SON_5}. Your marks have improved, too! I am proud of you! We can increase your time to an hour and a half each dayâ€¦ as long as you still do your homework first!
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Terima kasih, {F1_SON_5} kerana menyiapkan kerja sekolah sebelum menonton TV. Gred kamu juga bertambah baik! Ibu sangat bangga dengan kamu! Kalau begini, Ibu boleh tambahkan masa menonton TV kepada 1 jam setengah setiap hari... asalkan kamu menyiapkan kerja sekolah dahulu!

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Really?? Thank you, Ibu!!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Betul ke?? Terima kasih, Ibu!!

SourceText: Today is about learning what to do when our children misbehave. ğŸš©

SourceText: It is normal for children to misbehave when they are tired, scared, hungry, learning independence, wanting something, or avoiding a task. ğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£
text: Adalah perkara biasa bagi kanak-kanak untuk berkelakuan negatif apabila mereka letih, takut, lapar, belajar berdikari, mahukan sesuatu, atau mengelak daripada tugas. ğŸ˜’ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜£

SourceText: One thing you can do is to stop it before it starts. This is called Redirecting Behaviours.
text: Salah satu perkara yang boleh anda lakukan adalah menghentikan tingkah laku tersebut dari awal. Kita menyebutnya sebagai Mengalihkan Tingkah Laku.

SourceText: But what if children are already misbehaving? Can you still redirect their behaviour at that point?
text: Tapi macam mana kalau anak dah mula bertingkah laku negatif? Boleh lagi ke kita alih perhatian atau ubah tingkah lakunya ketika itu?

SourceText: True or False: You can use redirect at any time, even when your child is already behaving badly like having a tantrum.
text: Betul atau Salah: Walaupun anak anda sedang berkelakuan negatif, seperti mengamuk, anda boleh gunakan kaedah alihkan tingkah laku pada bila-bila masa.

SourceText: â¡ï¸ Redirecting your childâ€™s behaviour only works either before the behaviour begins or at the beginning of the behaviour (before it gets worse).
text: â¡ï¸ Mengalihkan tingkah laku anak anda hanya berkesan sekiranya sebelum tingkah laku itu bermula atau pada permulaan tingkah laku tersebut (sebelum menjadi lebih teruk).

SourceText: ğŸŒ·Anger is a normal part of everyday life, no matter where you live. So is misbehaving - especially if you are a child!
text: ğŸŒ· Marah adalah perkara biasa dalam kehidupan seharian, tak kira di mana kita tinggal. Begitu juga dengan kelakuan nakal - terutamanya bila kita masih kanak-kanak!

SourceText: ğŸ’™Feeling angry with your child has nothing to do with how much you love them or how good a job you are doing at parenting them.
text: ğŸ’™ Rasa marah terhadap anak tidak bermaksud anda kurang sayang atau anda bukan ibu bapa yang baik. Ia perkara biasa dan sebahagian daripada proses membesarkan anak.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ Learning how to manage your anger can help keep everyone safe.

SourceText: ğŸ’› Misbehaviour can be difficult, but try to manage your own stress and control your own anger before doing anything.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} wants to help his young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Lets see how he has the conversation with his young son, {F1_SON_5}.
text: {F1_FATHER} mahu membantu anak kecilnya belajar tentang sentuhan selamat dan sentuhan tidak selamat. Mari kita lihat cara dia berkomunikasi dengan anak lelakinya, {F1_SON_5}.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Did you enjoy the story, {F1_SON_5}?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kamu suka tak cerita tadi, {F1_SON_5}?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Yes, Ayah! It was fun!
text: {F1_SON_5}: Ya, Ayah! Saya sangat seronok!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Sekarang Ayah nak cakap tentang beberapa perkara penting berkaitan dengan menjaga tubuh badan kamu agar selamat dan sihat.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: What do you mean, Ayah?
text: {F1_SON_5}: Apa maksudnya, Ayah?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Pertama sekali, kita semua mempunyai anggota sulit pada tubuh kita. Anggota ini adalah anggota yang ditutup oleh pakaian dalam kita.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Like this?
text: {F1_SON_5}: Seperti ini?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Tepat sekali. Sesiapa pun tidak boleh menyentuh anggota sulit kamu kecuali untuk membersihkan dan untuk tujuan kesihatan, dan ini sangat penting untuk kamu ingat.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say 'no' if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kamu berhak untuk mengatakan 'tidak' sekiranya ada orang yang ingin menyentuh kamu dengan cara yang kamu tidak sukai, tubuh kamu adalah milik kamu.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okay, Ayah.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Baik, Ayah.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me or Ibu. We're here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kami sentiasa ada untuk melindungi kamu dan pastikan kamu selamat. Jadi, sekiranya terjadi apa-apa yang buat kamu rasa takut atau tidak selesa, kamu harus ingat bahawa kamu boleh beritahu kepada Ayah dan Ibu.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I will tell you and Ibu, Ayah.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Saya akan beritahu Ayah dan Ibu, Ayah.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I love you, {F1_SON_5}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ayah sayangkan kamu, {F1_SON_5}. Sini, peluk Ayah erat-erat!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} wants to help her young children learn about safe and unsafe touch. Lets see how she has the conversation with her young daughter, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}.
text: {F3_MOTHER} mahu membantu anak kecilnya belajar tentang sentuhan selamat dan sentuhan tidak selamat. Mari kita lihat cara dia berkomunikasi dengan anak perempuan kecilnya, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Did you enjoy the story, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu suka tak cerita tadi, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Yes, Mummy! It was fun!
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Ya, Mummy! Saya sangat suka!

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Now, there are some important things I want to talk to you about. It's about keeping your body safe and healthy.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Sekarang Mummy nak cakap tentang beberapa perkara penting berkaitan dengan menjaga tubuh badan kamu agar selamat dan sihat.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: What do you mean, Mummy?
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Apa maksudnya, Mummy?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: First, we all have private parts on our bodies. These are the parts that are covered by our underwear.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Pertama sekali, kita semua mempunyai anggota sulit pada tubuh kita. Anggota ini adalah anggota yang ditutup oleh pakaian dalam kita.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Like this?
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Seperti ini?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Exactly. It's important to remember that these parts are private, and no one should touch them except to keep you clean and healthy.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Tepat sekali. Sesiapa pun tidak boleh menyentuh anggota sulit kamu kecuali untuk membersihkan dan untuk tujuan kesihatan, dan ini sangat penting untuk kamu ingat.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Your body belongs to you, and you have the right to say 'no' if someone wants to touch you in a way that feels uncomfortable or wrong.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu berhak untuk mengatakan 'tidak' sekiranya ada orang yang ingin menyentuh kamu dengan cara yang kamu tidak sukai, tubuh kamu adalah milik kamu.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Okay, Mummy.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Baik, Mummy.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: And if anything ever happens that makes you feel scared or uneasy, remember you can always come and tell me. Iâ€™m here to protect you and keep you safe.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kami sentiasa ada untuk melindungi kamu dan pastikan kamu selamat. Jadi, sekiranya terjadi apa-apa yang buat kamu rasa takut atau tidak selesa, kamu harus ingat bahawa kamu boleh beritahu kepada Uncle dan Mummy.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: I will tell you, Mummy.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Saya akan beritahu, Mummy.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: I love you, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Now, let's give each other a big hug!
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Saya sayangkan kamu, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Mari peluk Mummy!

SourceText: ğŸ˜” It is normal to feel uncomfortable about talking to children about abuse.

SourceText: ğŸ’¡ But there are some simple things that can help them understand when it is not OK to be touched, and what they should do if something ever happens.

SourceText: It is important to learn how to respond in these conversations.
text: Penting untuk kita belajar cara memberi tindak balas dengan betul dalam perbualan seperti ini.

SourceText: Hereâ€™s a story about a time {F2_DAUGHTER_8} felt unsafe about someone touching her.
text: Berikut adalah kisah {F2_DAUGHTER_8} yang berasa tidak selesa apabila disentuh seseorang.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: (Tearing up) Paati, Uncle gives very long hugs! I donâ€™t like them.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: (Menangis) Paati, pakcik peluk saya lama-lama! Saya tak suka.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Oh dear, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}, that is not OK. Thank you for telling me about it, that is not okay.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Oh sayang, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}, ini tak OKEY. Terima kasih kerana beritahu Paati, tapi perbuatan pakcik itu tidak okey.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: If he ever tries to give you a hug again, you can tell him, â€œNo, letâ€™s rather shake hands,â€ and tell me straight away. Shall we practise?
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Jika dia cuba untuk peluk kamu lagi, kamu beritahu dia, "Tak boleh, boleh salam tangan sahaja," dan kamu terus beritahu saya. Nak berlatih?

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: (Practising) No, letâ€™s rather shake hands, please.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: (Berlatih) Tak boleh, boleh salam tangan sahaja.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Well done, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}. I love you very much and Iâ€™m so glad you spoke to me about it. If Uncle makes you feel uncomfortable again, you must tell me immediately. You should always feel safe and comfortable with the people around you.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Syabas, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}. Saya sangat sayangkan kamu dan saya gembira kamu bercakap dengan saya tentang perkara ini. Kamu mesti memberitahu saya jika pakcik kamu buat kamu rasa tidak selesa. Sepatutnya kamu berasa selamat dan selesa dengan orang di sekeliling kamu.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Thank you, Paati. Iâ€™m glad I can tell you about these things.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Terima kasih Paati. Saya gembira saya dapat beritahu Paati tentang perkara ini.

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} looks upset. Letâ€™s see how his father, {F1_FATHER} responds:
text: {F1_SON_5} nampak kecewa. Mari lihat bagaimana ayahnya, {F1_FATHER} menanganinya:

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: I don't want to play with Aiman today.
text: {F1_SON_5}: Saya tak nak bermain dengan Aiman hari ini.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: What happened, {F1_SON_5}? I thought you and Aiman were friends. Do you want to talk about it?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Kenapa, {F1_SON_5}? Ayah ingat kamu dan Aiman berkawan baik. Cuba beritahu Ayah, ada apa sebenarnya?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5} (crying): He and some of the other kids were mean to me. They said I was stupid because I canâ€™t button my shirt properly.
text: {F1_SON_5} (menangis): Aiman dan kawan-kawan lain membuli saya. Mereka cakap saya bodoh kerana saya tak pandai memasang butang baju saya sendiri.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Oh my {F1_SON_5}, that is not a very nice thing to say to anyone. I can understand why you would feel upset about this.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Anakku {F1_SON_5}, itu adalah kata-kata yang tak baik untuk dicakapkan kepada orang lain. Ayah faham sebab kamu berasa marah.

SourceText: First of all, you are not stupid! I am so proud about how much you are growing and learning. It is important that Aiman and the others know that it is not okay to say mean things. Would you like me to come with you so that we can have a chat with the others together?
text: Pertama sekali, kamu kena tahu yang kamu tak bodoh. Ayah bangga melihat kamu membesar dan belajar dengan baik. Tapi Aiman dan rakan-rakan Aiman yang lain perlu tahu bahawa kita tidak boleh bercakap perkara yang tidak baik. Kamu nak Ayah ikut kamu tak? Supaya Ayah boleh bercakap dengan Aiman dan rakan-rakan kamu yang lain bersama-sama?

SourceText: {F1_SON_5}: Okayâ€¦
text: {F1_SON_5}: Okeyâ€¦

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I can also have a chat with Aiman's parents to let them know. Aiman is a good boy and is usually nice to you so maybe there is something else happening.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Ayah juga boleh bercakap dengan ibu bapa Aiman dan memberitahu mereka apa yang terjadi. Aiman tu budak baik, dan biasanya dia baik dengan kamu, jadi mungkin ada perkara lain yang berlaku.

SourceText: Thank you for sharing with me, {F1_SON_5}. I am very proud of you.
text: Terima kasih kerana berkongsi dengan Ayah, {F1_SON_5}. Ayah bangga dengan kamu.

SourceText: ğŸŒ· It can be hard to see your child feeling upset or confused, but there is a lot you can do to support them.

SourceText: ğŸ”„In these moments, maintaining a consistent routine can be particularly helpful. Familiar routines can provide a sense of security and normalcy, helping your child feel safe again.

SourceText: ğŸˆ Remind your child again that you love them, and thank them for sharing with you.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8} is in trouble. Letâ€™s see how her grandmother, {F2_GRANDMOTHER} responds:
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8} berdepan dengan masalah. Mari lihat cara neneknya, {F2_GRANDMOTHER} bertindak balas:

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: My dear, you look really upset, do you want to tell me what happened?
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Sayang, kamu nampak kecewa, kamu nak beritahu Paati apa yang berlaku?

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Itâ€™s my Uncle, heâ€¦ heâ€¦ he touched me.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Pakcik, diaâ€¦ diaâ€¦ dia sentuh saya.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} (thinking): Take a deep breath... What does my child need? She needs me to be calm and listen. Come and sit down next to me. Take your time, Iâ€™m listening.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER} (berfikir): Tarik nafas panjang... Apakah yang diperlukan oleh cucu saya? Dia mahukan saya supaya bertenang dan mendengar. Datang ke mari dan duduk di sebelah saya. Ambil masa kamu, saya sedang mendengar.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Itâ€™s true, heâ€¦ heâ€¦ made me very uncomfortableâ€¦ he touched my body and told me Iâ€™d be in trouble if I told anybody! I didnâ€™t want to do anything with him, and I even said NO, but he told me I would be in trouble.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Betul, diaâ€¦ diaâ€¦ buat saya rasa tak selesaâ€¦ dia sentuh tubuh saya dan ugut saya jika saya beritahu kepada sesiapa! Saya tak suka dia sentuh saya, dan saya cakap TAK NAK, tapi dia ugut supaya saya mendengar katanya.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: You are so brave for sharing this with me. You are not in trouble. This is not your fault. Thank you for telling me.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Kamu sangat berani kerana berkongsi dengan saya. Ini bukan salah kamu, dan kamu takkan ditimpa masalah kerana beritahu hal ini. Terima kasih kerana memberitahu saya.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Yesterday, when you went to see your friend, he just came here and thatâ€™s when it happened.
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Semalam masa Paati keluar berjumpa kawan, pakcik datang ke sini dan ketika itu hal tersebut berlaku.

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Itâ€™s okay, I believe you, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}. You have done the right thing telling me. Whatâ€™s happened is not OK, but I am here for you to help you and support you. We will need to talk to someone who will help keep you safe. Would that be okay, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}? I will be with you at all times.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Semuanya okey, saya percaya kamu, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}. Kamu buat tindakan yang betul dengan beritahu kepada saya. Apa yang berlaku tak OKEY, tapi saya ada untuk menyokong dan membantu kamu. Kita perlu bercakap dengan seseorang yang boleh membantu menjaga keselamatan kamu. Okey tak, {F2_DAUGHTER_8}? saya akan menemani kamu setiap masa.

SourceText: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Yesâ€¦ Okayâ€¦ where will we go?
text: {F2_DAUGHTER_8}: Yaâ€¦ Okeyâ€¦ kita nak ke mana?

SourceText: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Let us go to the clinic. And {F2_DAUGHTER_8} remember this is not your fault. I love you and will always be here with you. We will get through this.
text: {F2_GRANDMOTHER}: Jom kita ke klinik. Dan {F2_DAUGHTER_8} ingat, ini bukan salah kamu. Paati sangat sayangkan kamu. Kita akan selesaikan perkara ini bersama.

SourceText: How can you support your child online? Hereâ€™s a quick question to get you going!

SourceText: True or False: Parents should set time limits on how long their child can use the internet each day.
text: Betul atau Salah: Penggunaan Internet anak-anak perlu dipantau setiap hari oleh ibu bapa dengan menetapkan had masa.

SourceText: Social media is everywhere - and children often want to be a part of it too. True or false: It is safe for young children to have their social media accounts without parental supervision.
text: Media sosial ada di mana-mana - dan kanak-kanak selalunya ingin turut serta juga. Betul atau salah: Memang selamat untuk kanak-kanak mempunyai akaun media sosial sendiri tanpa pemantauan ibu bapa.

text: ğŸ”‘ Sekatan umur pada media sosial mempunyai sebab-sebab tertentu.

SourceText: ğŸ‘€ Young children should not have social media accounts without parental guidance and supervision, as they may encounter inappropriate content or interactions.
text: ğŸ‘€ Anak-anak tidak sepatutnya mempunyai akaun media sosial mereka sendiri tanpa panduan dan pantauan daripada ibu bapa kerana mereka akan terdedah kepada kandungan atau interaksi yang tidak sesuai.

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} wants to play games on the handphone. Her mother, {F3_MOTHER}, uses this opportunity to teach {F3_DAUGHTER_4} about how to stay safe online:
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4} mahu menonton video di telefon bimbit. Ibunya, {F3_MOTHER}, menggunakan peluang ini untuk mengajar {F3_DAUGHTER_4} tentang keselamatan semasa berada dalam talian:

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Mummy, my friend played games on her phone yesterday. Can I use the phone to play games too?
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Mummy, kawan saya tengok video dekat telefon semalam. Saya pun nak tengok, boleh tak?

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Sure, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}! But letâ€™s first learn how to be safe when using gadgets. First, the household rule is that you can only use gadgets for 30 minutes each day. I will set a timer that will go off when you have 5 minutes left.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Boleh, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}! Tapi mula-mula kita belajar macam mana kita nak menggunakan gajet dengan selamat. Peraturan pertama, kamu boleh gunakan gajet selama 30 minit sahaja setiap hari. Mummy akan guna 'alarm' untuk bagi tahu kamu bila tinggal 5 minit saja lagi sebelum masa tamat.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Also, always ask Mummy for permission before using any device. You should also only play games or watch videos that we have approved, okay?
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Kamu juga harus minta izin daripada Mummy terlebih dahulu sebelum menggunakan apa-apa peranti. Kamu hanya boleh bermain permainan atau menonton video yang kita dah setuju sahaja, ya?

SourceText: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Can I create my own account for pictures and videos, Mummy? My friend has an account for herself.
text: {F3_DAUGHTER_4}: Boleh tak kalau saya buka akaun saya sendiri untuk gambar dan video, Mummy? Alesya ada akaun sendiri.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: Not just yet, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Social media is for older kids. We'll wait until you're a bit older. But we can post pictures on my account together if you want.
text: {F3_MOTHER}: Belum lagi, {F3_DAUGHTER_4}. Media sosial sesuai untuk remaja. Kita tunggu kamu besar sikit ya. Tapi kalau kamu nak 'post' gambar, kamu boleh sama-sama gunakan akaun Mummy.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER}: And remember, never click on a pop-up or picture if it appears. Also, if anything ever upsets you, let us know right away. We're here to keep you safe!

SourceText: Welcome back! Todayâ€™s skill is about how you and your spouse can set an example for your children by creating respect at home. ğŸ’™

SourceText: Family and friends might have their own ideas about how you should act as a spouse or a parent.â—
text: Keluarga dan rakan mungkin ada pandangan tersendiri tentang bagaimana anda patut bertindak sebagai pasangan atau ibu bapa.â—

SourceText: But what matters most is how both husband and wife choose to talk to and support each other, and make decisions together and respectfully. ğŸ”„
text: Tapi yang paling penting adalah bagaimana suami dan isteri memilih untuk berbincang dan saling menyokong antara satu sama lain, serta membuat keputusan bersama dengan penuh rasa hormat. ğŸ”„

SourceText: Think about working as a team! Try this.
text: Cuba bekerjasama seperti satu pasukan! Mari jawab kuiz ini.

SourceText: True or False: Important decisions that impact the whole family or the relationship should only be made by one spouse.
text: Betul atau Salah: Keputusan penting yang memberi kesan kepada seluruh keluarga atau hubungan suami isteri perlu dibuat oleh salah seorang daripada pasangan sahaja.

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ When making big decisions that impact the whole family or relationship, it is important for spouses to practise making decisions together.
text: ğŸ”‘ Penting untuk pasangan berlatih membuat keputusan bersama-sama kerana ia memberi kesan kepada seluruh keluarga atau hubungan suami isteri.

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ Communicating and making big decisions together with our spouse is an important part of having a respectful relationship.
text: ğŸ”‘ Berkomunikasi dan membuat keputusan besar secara bersama adalah bahagian penting dalam menjalin hubungan yang penuh perasaan hormat.

SourceText: Letâ€™s observe how couples can value each otherâ€™s opinions and make decisions together:
text: Mari kita perhatikan bagaimana pasangan boleh menghargai pendapat satu sama lain dan membuat keputusan bersama-sama:

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: My dear, you look worried. Whatâ€™s wrong?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Sayang, kamu kelihatan risau. Ada apa-apa yang tak kena?

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: The stove has not been working very well recently. I think the stove might be broken.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Dapur ini tidak berfungsi dengan baik sejak kebelakangan ini. Saya rasa dapur ini rosak.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I noticed this too when I was cooking last week. I wanted to ask you: do you think we should buy a new one?
text: {F1_FATHER}: Abang juga perasan tentang perkara ini semasa memasak minggu lepas. Abang nak tanya, sayang fikir perlukah kita beli yang baharu?

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Buying a new one would be really expensive. How about we talk about it after dinner, and we can make a decision together?
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Mungkin terlalu mahal untuk beli yang baru. Bagaimana kalau kita bincang tentangnya selepas makan malam, dan kita boleh buat keputusan bersama?

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: That sounds great. Thank you for cooking dinner, my dear!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Itu cadangan yang baik. Terima kasih kerana masakkan makan malam, sayang!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: I am grateful we can talk about this and make this decision together. It makes a lot more sense to try to get it repaired first.
text: {F1_FATHER}: â€œAbang gembira kita dapat berbincang tentang ini dan buat keputusan bersama. Lebih elok jika kita baikinya dahulu.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Me too. I feel a lot better now that we have talked about it together.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Saya pun rasa lebih lega sekarang selepas bincang tentang ini bersama-sama.

SourceText: ğŸ˜ƒ It can be hard to know how to involve your spouse when making a decision.

SourceText: â° Choose a time when you and your spouse are not too busy to discuss decisions, such as early in the morning or later in the evening.
text: â° Pilih masa ketika anda dan pasangan tidak terlalu sibuk untuk berbincang tentang sesuatu keputusan, seperti awal pagi atau lewat petang.

SourceText: Let's reflect on this with a quick question.

SourceText: True or False: It is only the role of the mother and not the father to parent a child.
text: Betul atau Salah: Tugas membesarkan anak-anak merupakan tugas yang digalas oleh ibu, bukannya bapa.

SourceText: ğŸ’› When both mothers and fathers are involved in parenting their children everyone benefits!
text: ğŸ’› Seluruh keluarga akan mendapat manfaat apabila kedua-dua ibu bapa terlibat dalam usaha mendidik anak-anak!

text: âœ¨ Jawapan anda betul!

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} really knows what it means to be a supportive husband and parent. Notice how he cares for his wife, {F1_MOTHER}:
text: {F1_FATHER} menyedari betapa pentingnya untuk dia menjadi seorang suami dan bapa yang sentiasa memberikan sokongan. Perhatikan cara dia mengambil berat terhadap isterinya, {F1_MOTHER}:

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Good job, {F1_SON_5}! You are reading very well!
text: {F1_FATHER}: Bagus, {F1_SON_5}! Kamu membaca dengan sangat baik!

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: Yes, he has improved a lot. Good job, son! I'm sure our daily practices have paid off.
text: {F1_MOTHER}: Ya, bacaannya semakin baik. Bagus, sayang! Tak sia-sia kita berlatih setiap hari.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER}: Indeed. You look tired, dear. Why don't you go take a rest for a moment? I can continue helping the children with their homework while you rest.
text: {F1_FATHER}: Betul tu. Awak nampak letih, sayang. Apa kata awak berehat sekejap? Saya boleh bantu anak-anak siapkan kerja sekolah sementara awak berehat.

SourceText: {F1_MOTHER}: That would be wonderful, my love! Thank you for being so supportive.

text: "Saya tahu - mungkin saya boleh mulakan dengan satu pelan. Mula-mula, saya akan buat bajet â€“ pelan bagaimana saya boleh simpan duit saya. Kemudian, saya akan menyimpan wang sedikit demi sedikit â€“ dan saya juga akan menyertai kumpulan simpanan dan pinjaman."

SourceText: "I should also speak with my children to choose things that we can spend just a little bit less on each week. They will help me think of things we want but donâ€™t need."
text: "Saya perlu bercakap dengan anak-anak saya untuk memilih perkara-perkara yang boleh dikurangkan sedikit belanja pada setiap minggu. Mereka akan membantu saya untuk memikirkan barang-barang yang kami mahu tetapi tidak perlu."

Dengan menyimpan sikit demi sikit setiap minggu, saya berjaya bayar yuran universiti {F3_DAUGHTER_4} dan simpan juga untuk universiti {F3_SON_7}. Saya sangat bangga dengan pencapaian ini.â€

text: 4ï¸âƒ£ TABUNG KECEMASAN

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ GET SUPPORT
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ DAPATKAN SOKONGAN

SourceText: 5ï¸âƒ£ Here are five tips on how to make a savings plan for you and your child:
text: 5ï¸âƒ£ Berikut adalah lima tip tentang cara untuk membuat perancangan simpanan untuk anda dan anak anda:

SourceText: Decide why you want to save money. These could include:
text: Cari sebab anda perlu menyimpan wang. Ini mungkin termasuk:

SourceText: ğŸ˜” Preparing for emergencies
text: ğŸ˜” Persediaan menghadapi kecemasan

SourceText: ğŸ Buying something nice for you or your child or do something fun as a family
text: ğŸ Membeli hadiah untuk diri sendiri atau anak anda atau untuk berseronok bersama keluarga

SourceText: ğŸ“– Planning for future big expenses like improvements on your home or for your childâ€™s education
text: ğŸ“– Merancang perbelanjaan besar pada masa hadapan seperti pengubahsuaian rumah, atau untuk pendidikan anak anda

SourceText: ğŸš© Set a target amount that you want to save.
text: ğŸš© Tentukan jumlah sasaran yang anda ingin simpan.

SourceText: ğŸ’° Look at your monthly budget and decide how much you can save each week and each month.
text: ğŸ’° Lihat bajet bulanan anda dan tentukan berapa banyak yang boleh anda simpan setiap minggu dan setiap bulan.

SourceText: Consider the different ways to keep money safe for future use. These could include:
text: Pertimbangkan cara yang berbeza untuk menyimpan wang di masa depan. Ini mungkin termasuk:

SourceText: ğŸ”‘ Saving at a bank
text: ğŸ”‘ Simpan wang di bank

SourceText: ğŸ’š Keeping money safe at home
text: ğŸ’š Simpan wang dengan selamat di rumah

SourceText: ğŸ’° Keeping money in a savings and loan group
text: ğŸ’° Simpan wang dalam kumpulan simpanan atau pinjaman

SourceText: ğŸŒ· Buying livestock like goats or cattle
text: ğŸŒ· Beli ternakan seperti kambing atau lembu

SourceText: Decide which way of saving money would work best for the family.
text: Tentukan cara simpanan mana yang paling berkesan untuk keluarga anda.

SourceText: â— If you can try and save even a tiny amount for the future or for an emergency. This can make a big difference over time.
text: â— Jika boleh, cuba untuk menyimpan walaupun sedikit untuk masa depan atau kecemasan. Tabung kecemasan ini boleh membawa perubahan besar secara beransuran.

SourceText: ğŸŒ± Your government or community groups may be giving money, vouchers, or food parcels to families in need.
text: ğŸŒ± Organisasi kerajaan atau komuniti anda mungkin ada menyumbang wang, baucar, atau bungkusan makanan kepada keluarga yang memerlukan.

SourceText: ğŸ’› Think about whether there are places in your community that provide support.
text: ğŸ’› Fikirkan sama ada terdapat tempat dalam komuniti anda yang menawarkan bantuan.

SourceText: The final home activity of this goal is to create your savings plan. â­ Do you have time to do it today?
text: Aktiviti di Rumah! â­ Sudah tiba masanya untuk anda merancang simpanan anda. Adakah anda mempunyai masa untuk lakukannya hari ini?

SourceText: Thatâ€™s great! Congratulations. ğŸ’š
text: Bagus! Tahniah. ğŸ’š

SourceText: Well done, you have completed the final step in making a family budget and have earned yourself the family budgeting trophy! Congratulations! â­
text: Syabas, Anda telah melengkapkan langkah terakhir belanjawan keluarga dan telah berjaya memperoleh lencana belanjawan keluarga! Tahniah! â­
